channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: When the music stops: the unravelling of AI companies’ flawed valuations
item.description: Right now, we’re already slipping into the Trough of Disillusionment and when the AI bubble bursts, the flawed valuations will be exposed.

item.title: Disney’s Bob Iger achieves an essential feat for outgoing CEOs: giving his successor a clean slate
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: Gen Z’s latest status symbol is running a marathon—and it’s terrible news for Gucci, Louis Vuitton, and Hermès
item.description: “I feel like saying that you ran—or that you run, or that you're going to run—the New York City Marathon is huge clout in New York,” one influencer sa...

item.title: Iran Is at Work on Missile and Nuclear Sites, Satellite Images Show
item.description: Repairs at key missile sites began soon after they were hit by Israeli and U.S. strikes last year, but work at Iran’s nuclear facilities has been slow...

item.title: Europe Accuses TikTok of ‘Addictive Design’ and Pushes for Change
item.description: European Union regulators said the app’s infinite scroll and personalized algorithm led to “compulsive” behavior, especially among children.

item.title: U.S. Olympic medalist barely earns enough to cover rent but makes 5 times more on social media

item.title: U.S. and Iran Set for Talks in Oman
item.description: Middle Eastern diplomats see a chance for progress on Iran’s nuclear program, but they are pessimistic about other U.S. demands.

item.title: America’s Game
item.description: We tell you everything you need to know about this year’s Super Bowl.

item.title: The Growing List of Names in the Epstein Files, and the Federal Investigation into D.E.I. at Nike
What to Expect at the Olympic Opening Ceremonies, From the Man Behind Them
item.description: Marco Balich has helped design grand spectacles at more than half a dozen Olympics. On Friday, he’ll do it again, on home turf in Italy.

item.title: Norway Rallies Behind Royals, Despite Dismay Over Epstein Links

item.title: U.S. and Iran Set for Talks in Oman
item.description: Middle Eastern diplomats see a chance for progress on Iran’s nuclear program, but they are pessimistic about other U.S. demands.

item.title: Russian General Is Shot in Moscow
item.description: The attack bore the hallmark of several assassination attempts on top military officers in the Russian capital.

item.title: OpenAI’s new model leaps ahead in coding capabilities—but raises unprecedented cybersecurity risks
item.description: Why OpenAI’s latest coding breakthrough is forcing the company to rethink how—and how fast—it can deploy its most powerful models.
